post_text: Aug. 25 Parent Forum
text: Aug. 25 Parent Forum

post_text:
Parent Forum Tonight at 4 p.m.

Our counseling team of Erika Andrews and Kelsey Kaul will present an overview of what Social Emotional Learning (SEL) looks like. Jennifer McDonald, Behavior Support Specialist/Restorative Coach, will also join us as her role supports SEL.

Additionally, all three of our staff members supporting the leadership transition until we hire a High School Principal will be present (Sarah Hansen, HS Librarian; Kelsey Kaul, HS Counselor; and Megan Ticer, Assistant to the Superintendent/Licensed School Administrator).

Rob Pridemore, our Athletic Director, will give updates on recent athletics changes and regulations. RGS Interim Principal Stephanie Kendall will be introduced.

Additionally, there will be a brief Q&A at the end. Please send your questions to communications@riverdale.k12.or.us for us to continue to build out our Q and A responses on the FAQ section of our Return to Learn webpage.
https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/3063045190503635467

post_text:
Model United Nations wins big!
The RHS team won four out of the seven categories they submitted resolutions for at the Oregon MUN virtual conference.

Winning resolutions were written by:
General Assembly "Crisis in Venezuela" - Cameron B

Commission on the Status of Women "Lessening the Disproportion of Women in Government"- Ava W

Health and Human Services "Black Market Medication" - Emma J

Environment "Coral Bleaching" - Carter C

‚ÄúI am so proud of the students and their hard work. Although the resolutions were ultimately written and submitted by individuals, each represents a team effort. MUN is a 'team sport,' and all of the students involved this year should be congratulated,‚Äù says MUN Teacher/Advisor Sarah Hansen.

post_text: Three months ago, our buildings were full of students who were, as none of us knew, all together for the last time. Much has changed since then, and we would like to congratulate all of our students, staff, families and community for your resilience during these unprecedented times. Have a good summer, and we look forward to seeing you in the fall!
text: Three months ago, our buildings were full of students who were, as none of us knew, all together for the last time. Much has changed since then, and we would like to congratulate all of our students, staff, families and community for your resilience during these unprecedented times. Have a good summer, and we look forward to seeing you in the fall!

Two of our grade school teachers are working their buns off in and out of school. They‚Äôre helping Ms. Light‚Äôs sister who began baking cinnamon rolls and auctioning them off - resulting in almost $40k raised for the Oregon Food Bank. post_text:
To All Staff and Teachers,

Thank you for launching Riverdale's Distance Learning on April 1 (12 days before ODE Guidance).
Thank you for your hard work and willingness to make adjustments on how you teach students with little notice.
Thank you for demonstrating patience and grace.
Thank you for caring about our students' success while tending to your own family and stresses.
Thank you for working with parents to meet their student's needs, which is often not seen by others.
Thank you for working overtime and during your spring break.
Thank you for your willingness to be vulnerable and for your willingness to do hard things.
Thank you for missing our children. They miss you too.

We are only nine school days into our distance learning model, and everyone is doing a great job!!

Thank you.

Riverdale School Board
text:
To All Staff and Teachers,

Thank you for launching Riverdale's Distance Learning on April 1 (12 days before ODE Guidance).
Thank you for your hard work and willingness to make adjustments on how you teach students with little notice.
Thank you for demonstrating patience and grace.
Thank you for caring about our students' success while tending to your own family and stresses.
Thank you for working with parents to meet their student's needs, which is often not seen by others.
Thank you for working overtime and during your spring break.
Thank you for your willingness to be vulnerable and for your willingness to do hard things.
Thank you for missing our children. They miss you too.

We are only nine school days into our distance learning model, and everyone is doing a great job!!

Thank you.

Riverdale School Board

post_text: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never fair to put anyone in a box. You never know anything about someone by just looking at them, and your skin color doesn‚Äôt make you the same.‚Äù - Wyjuana Montgomery met with 5th-8th graders to discuss her book, ‚ÄúBold, Brave and Courageous.‚Äù Students read her book in their English language arts classes. They then asked meaningful questions about it and her inspirational life yesterday and today.

post_text: Congratulations to Reese on the Honorable Mention in this year‚Äôs Scholastic Arts and Writing Awards! ‚ÄúMy art piece represents how quick people are to judge, stereotype and categorize others. The book being read is a dictionary in which the names of everyday people are listed. Next to each person is their ‚Äúdefinition‚Äù or how society views and thus defines them. I created the piece so people would realize that perhaps they are doing this and that a human‚Äôs existence should not be limited down to so few words; we each have complex reasoning for everything we do.‚Äù - 8th grader Reese
text: Congratulations to Reese on the Honorable Mention in this year‚Äôs Scholastic Arts and Writing Awards! ‚ÄúMy art piece represents how quick people are to judge, stereotype and categorize others. The book being read is a dictionary in which the names of everyday people are listed. Next to each person is their ‚Äúdefinition‚Äù or how society views and thus defines them. I created the piece so people would realize that perhaps they are doing this and that a human‚Äôs existence should not be limited down to so few words; we each have complex reasoning for everything we do.‚Äù - 8th grader Reese

post_text: Thank you for the great work!
shared_text:
Bremik Construction
December 5, 2019 at 6:03 PM ¬∑

We took last week off for the holidays, but this week we're back with our next top 15 favorite project, in celebration of our 15 years in business! #RiverdaleGradeSchool was completed in 2010 in partnership with Mahlum and Riverdale School District.

The pre-existing Riverdale Grade School was designed by renowned Portland-based architect A.E. Doyle, and #Bremik worked closely with the project team and community during design to determine if it would be more economical and sustainable long-term to renovate the building or to start from scratch. After much deliberation and many conversations, it was determined that it would be better to build a new school.

To honor the grade school's architectural heritage despite starting anew, a lot of attention was given to replicating some of the unique features of A.E. Doyle's original design. The final building achieved #LEEDGold certification and boasts 24 classrooms, a media center, administrative offices, and a 4,000 SF multi-purpose room.
text:
Thank you for the great work!

Bremik Construction
December 5, 2019 at 6:03 PM ¬∑

We took last week off for the holidays, but this week we're back with our next top 15 favorite project, in celebration of our 15 years in business! #RiverdaleGradeSchool was completed in 2010 in partnership with Mahlum and Riverdale School District.

The pre-existing Riverdale Grade School was designed by renowned Portland-based architect A.E. Doyle, and #Bremik worked closely with the project team and community during design to determine if it would be more economical and sustainable long-term to renovate the building or to start from scratch. After much deliberation and many conversations, it was determined that it would be better to build a new school.

To honor the grade school's architectural heritage despite starting anew, a lot of attention was given to replicating some of the unique features of A.E. Doyle's original design. The final building achieved #LEEDGold certification and boasts 24 classrooms, a media center, administrative offices, and a 4,000 SF multi-purpose room.
